cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 115 mi ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest today, then turning northwest across the central Gulf and toward the north-western Gulf Coast (Louisiana/upper-Texas border) early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-western Gulf Coast, most likely south-eastern Louisiana

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Punta Herrero to Cancún, Mexico
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning: Punta Herrero to Dzilam, Mexico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Yucatán Peninsula today; central Gulf Sunday/Monday; north-western Gulf Coast (LA–upper-TX) Monday night-Tuesday
weather_observation.wind: Outer bands may bring occasional tropical-storm-force gusts (30–40 mph) to the upper Texas coast late Monday into Tuesday, though the highest chances remain east of Texas City.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation of 1–2 ft above ground level possible during the Tuesday morning high tide, mainly east of Galveston Bay. Surge above 3 ft is not expected at Texas City.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible in bands Monday night through Tuesday; totals over 4 inches are not expected.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and swells could cause rough bar conditions beginning late Monday.
